gurmukhi: ਬਾਜਤ ਤਾਲ ਮੁਚੰਗ ਪਖਾਵਜ ਨਾਚਤ ਕੋਟਨਿ ਕੋਟਿ ਅਖਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Baajat Taal Mouchannd Pakhaavaj Naachat Kotan(i) Kottee Akhdare||
translation: The drums and other musical instruments resounded and the dances of various kinds were arranged.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਅਗੂਅਾ ਸੁਤ ਕੱੳੁ ਪਿਤੁ ਲੈ ਪੁਰ ਅੳੁਧ ਸਿਧਾਰੇ ॥੧੫੭॥
transliteration: Aan(i) Mile Sabh Hiagooaa Sout Kau Pit(u) Lai Pur Audh Sidhdare||157||
translation: All the people advanced to meet Ram and the father Dasrath took his son with him and reached Oudhpuri (in his palaces).157.

gurmukhi: ਸਭਹੂ ਮਿਲਿ ਗਿਲ ਕੀਯੋ ੳੁਛਾਹਾ ॥ ਪੂਤ ਤਿਹੂੰ ਕੳੁ ਰਚਯੋ ਬਿਯਾਹਾ ॥
transliteration: Sabh-hoo Mil(i) Gil Keeyo Ouchhaadaa|| Poot Tihoon Kau Rachyo Biyaahaa||
translation: With great enthusiasm the marriage of the three remaining sons was fixed.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਸੀਅਾ ਬਰ ਕੈ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲੇ ॥ ਦੇਸ ਬਿਦੇਸਨ ਹੋਤ ਬਧਾੲੇ ॥੧੫੮॥
transliteration: Raam Seeaa Bar Kai Ghar(i) Aae|| Des Bidesan Hot Badhaae||158||
translation: After the marriage of Ram and Sita, the congratulatory messages were received from various countries, when they returned to their home.158.

gurmukhi: ਜਹ ਤਹ ਹੋਤ ੳੁਛਾਹ ਅਪਾਰੂ ॥ ਤਿਹੂੰ ਸੁਤਨ ਕੋ ਬਯਾਹ ਬਿਚਾਰੂ ॥
transliteration: Jah Tah Hot Ouchhaad Apdaroo|| Tihoon Soutan Ko Byaah Bichdaroo||
translation: There was atmosphere of zest on all sides and the arrangements were being made for the celebration of the marriage of three sons.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜਤ ਤਾਲ ਮ੍ਰਿਦੰਗ ਅਪਾਰੰ ॥ ਨਾਚਤ ਕੋਟਨ ਕੋਟ ਅਖਾਰੰ ॥੧੫੯॥
transliteration: Baajat Taal Mridan Apaaran|| Naachat Kotan Kot Akhaaran||159||
translation: On all sides the drums resounded in various tunes and many companies of dancers began to dance.159.

gurmukhi: ਬਨ ਬਨ ਬੀਰ ਪਖਰੀਅਾ ਚਲੇ ॥ ਜੋਬਨਵੰਤ ਸਿਪਾਹੀ ਭਲੇ ॥
transliteration: Ban Ban Beer Pakdareeaa Chale|| Jobanvant Sipaahibhale||
translation: The warriors decorated with armours and the youthful soldiers marched forward.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਜਾੲਿ ੲਿਸਥਤ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਦਰ ਪਰ ॥ ਮਹਾਰਥੀ ਅਰੁ ਮਹਾ ਧਨੁਰਧਰ ॥੧੬੦॥
transliteration: Bhae Jaae Isthat Nrip Dar Par|| Mahaarathiar(u) Mahaa Dhanurdhar||160||
translation: All these great charioteers and archers came and stood at the gate of the king Dasrath.160.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜਤ ਜੰਗ ਮੁਚੰਗ ਅਪਾਰੰ ॥ ਢੋਲ ਮ੍ਰਿਦੰਗ ਸੁਰੰਗ ਸੁਧਾਰੰ ॥
transliteration: Baajat Jan Mouchannd Apaaran|| Dhol Mridan Suran Sudhaaran||
translation: Many types of musical instruments resounded and the melodious sounds of the drums were heard.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਵਤ ਗੀਤ ਚੰਚਲਾ ਨਾਰੀ ॥ ਨੈਨ ਨਚਾੲਿ ਬਜਾਵਤ ਤਾਰੀ ॥੧੬੧॥
transliteration: Gadvat Geet Channdhalaa Ndaree|| Nain Nachaae Bajaavat Tdaree||161||
translation: The energetic women began to sing and reveal their joy by dancing their eyes and clapping their hands.161.

gurmukhi: ਭਿੱਛਕਨ ਹਵਸ ਨ ਧਨ ਕੀ ਰਹੀ ॥ ਦਾਨ ਸ੍ਵਰਨ ਸਰਤਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਬਹੀ ॥
transliteration: Bhichchhakan Havas Na Dhan Kirahee|| Daan Svaran Sartaahue Bahee||
translation: The beggars had no more desire for wealth because the gift of gold flowed like a stream.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਬਾਤ ਮਾਗਨ ਕੱੳੁ ਅਾਵੈ ॥ ਬੀਸਕ ਬਾਤ ਘਰੈ ਲੈ ਜਾਵੈ ॥੧੬੨॥
transliteration: Ek Baat Maagad Kau Aavai|| Beesak Baat Gdarai Lai Jaavai||162||
translation: Anyone who asked for one thing, he would return to his home with twenty things.162.

gurmukhi: ਬਨ ਬਨ ਚਲਤ ਭੲੇ ਰਘੁਨੰਦਨ ॥ ਫੂਲੇ ਪੁਹਪ ਬਸੰਤ ਜਾਨੁ ਬਨ ॥
transliteration: Ban Ban Chalet Bhae Raghounandan|| Phoole Puhap Basant Jaan(u) Ban||
translation: The sons of king Dasrath playing in the forests appeared like the flowers bloomed in spring season.
